paper.title: Title of the Paper
paper.summary: This paper focuses on developing predictive models for enteric methane emissions in dairy cows. The main model (Eq. 1) is a linear regression equation that predicts daily methane emissions (CH₄, g/d) as a function of dry matter intake (DMI, kg/d) and dietary neutral detergent fiber concentration (NDF, % of DM). The model was developed using individual cow records and demonstrates good predictive performance (R² = 0.71) for lactating Holstein cows in freestall production systems.

equations.latex: CH_4 = a + b 	imes DMI + c 	imes NDF

target_quantity.name: enteric methane emission
target_quantity.description: Daily enteric methane emissions from lactating cows

equations.applicability: Model applicable to Holstein dairy cows in freestall production systems, parity 1-3+, DIM 60-300 days, in US Midwest. Diet: High-forage TMR with corn silage and alfalfa silage.
equations.model_performance: R² = 0.71, RMSE = 2.3 g/d. Model based on individual cow records from 3 herds (210 cows total), validated using random 80/20 train-test split.
equations.text_context: Methane emissions were modeled as a function of dry matter intake and dietary NDF concentration (Eq. 1). Parameters of the model were estimated using linear mixed-effects regression with cow as random effect.
equations.explanation: write a concise paragraph to explain the relavence to the task and your understand of the extracted equation
equations.notes: special instruction of the equation, e.g., model used only for lactating cows; not validated for dry cows.

equations.latex: MY = a + b 	imes DIM + c 	imes DIM^2
equations.applicability: Model for Holstein cows in early to mid-lactation, DIM 5-200 days, in conventional freestall systems.
equations.model_performance: R² = 0.68, RMSE = 2.1 kg/d. Model fitted to 450 lactation records from 2 commercial dairy farms.
equations.text_context: Milk yield was modeled as a quadratic function of days in milk to capture the typical lactation curve pattern (Eq. 2). The model accounts for peak production around 60-80 DIM followed by gradual decline.
equations.explanation: write a concise paragraph to explain the relavence to the task and your understand of the extracted equation
equations.notes: Model validated for primiparous and multiparous cows separately.

extraction_metadata.instruction: Extract all equations related to enteric methane emission.
